result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $2,915.45 to be paid as follows with co-defendant James Carter (joint/severally) as a Condition of Probation. ($1,007.00 to Omar M. and $1,908.45 to Alliance Collection Service)

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA surcharge is WAIVED.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No contact with co-defendant James C. or victim Omar M.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Attend Anger Management classes.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholaus H Uihlein in court, in custody, with attorney Paul Bugenhagen.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct 1.


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 2 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $1007.00 to be paid to Omar M. and $1908.45 to be paid to Alliance Collection Service joint and severally with co-defendant James Carter as a condition of Probation.               
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No contact with co-defendant James C. or victim Omar M..  Anger Management.  No Weapons.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 - 56 days jail straight time - consecutive to any other sentence -  Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH - 4 days credit.  

Expunction addressed.
State takes no position
Court denies request for expunction
